title: Get a Computer
description: My first computer - the gateway to a lifelong passion. Started with an IBM 286, learned QBASIC, and built things with LEGO that sparked my imagination for creating interactive systems.

monstersDefeated.name: Friends having cooler gadgets
monstersDefeated.description: While others had newer computers and consoles, I learned to make the most of what I had - creativity over hardware.

lootDropped.name: Learned how to tweak other programs
lootDropped.description: Discovered I could modify existing code and make programs do what I wanted.

lootDropped.name: Just having fun
lootDropped.description: The pure joy of creating something on a computer - no pressure, just exploration.

title: Make My First Program
description: Created my first real programs using TI-83 calculator and Visual Basic. Started to understand that programming could be useful and powerful.

monstersDefeated.name: PIRATES
monstersDefeated.description: Fighting against software piracy and learning the value of protecting your work.

lootDropped.name: Made me better at languages + programming
lootDropped.description: Understanding that programming languages are tools for expression and creation.

lootDropped.name: Felt more confident I can do things useful for myself and others
lootDropped.description: Realized my skills could actually help people and solve real problems.

lootDropped.name: Got +10 coins
lootDropped.description: First taste of earning money from programming skills.

title: Surviving University
description: Moved to Skellefte√• in northern Sweden to study game development for 3 years. Learned modern C++, physics, and how to live independently while pursuing my dream.

monstersDefeated.name: Motivation
monstersDefeated.description: Some days it was hard to keep going, but passion for game development kept me moving forward.

lootDropped.name: Found love for programming
lootDropped.description: University solidified that this wasn't just a hobby - it was my calling.

lootDropped.name: Modern C++
lootDropped.description: Learned professional-grade C++ that would serve me throughout my career.

lootDropped.name: Physics for game developers
lootDropped.description: Understanding the math and physics that make games feel real.

lootDropped.name: Living by myself
lootDropped.description: Independence and self-reliance - essential life skills.

lootDropped.name: Algebra
lootDropped.description: Mathematical foundations for graphics programming and game logic.

lootDropped.name: Worlds best Rallysport driver!
lootDropped.description: Became world champion at Rallisport Challenge 2 - dedication pays off!

title: Making a Game with Artist
description: Collaborated with an artist for the first time using Gamebryo engine. Learned the delicate balance between technical constraints and artistic vision.

monstersDefeated.name: Compromises between tech vs art
monstersDefeated.description: Artists want beauty, engineers want performance - finding the middle ground is an art itself.

lootDropped.name: Made me more understanding of how artist work
lootDropped.description: Learned to speak the artist's language and appreciate their creative process.

title: Making My Own Game Engine
description: Built a complete game engine from scratch using advanced C++ and OpenGL. One of the most creative and challenging solo projects I've ever undertaken.

monstersDefeated.name: Working by myself for a long time
monstersDefeated.description: Solo development can be isolating, but it taught me self-discipline and perseverance.

lootDropped.name: Working on something longer term and seeing the results of that
lootDropped.description: Patience and persistence - watching a complex system come together piece by piece.

lootDropped.name: One of the most creative things I have done
lootDropped.description: Building an engine is like creating a universe with its own rules and possibilities.

lootDropped.name: Passion + time = something unique
lootDropped.description: Discovered that deep focus over time creates something truly special.

title: Making a Game for Nokia N-Gage
description: Developed a game for the Nokia N-Gage platform. Working with hardware constraints taught me optimization and working with other engineers who had different approaches.

monstersDefeated.name: Hard to work with other engineers wanting different things
monstersDefeated.description: Different engineers have different coding styles and priorities - learning to collaborate and compromise.

lootDropped.name: Learned a bit on AI programming
lootDropped.description: First exposure to game AI - making NPCs feel alive within tight memory constraints.

lootDropped.name: Really fun to work on restricted hardware
lootDropped.description: Constraints breed creativity - limited resources force innovative solutions.

title: Agency 9
description: My master's thesis and first real job in the industry. Worked with a team in Finland on COLLADA format integration with Blender. Learned the realities of professional software development.

monstersDefeated.name: Lots of issues working with a team in another country - no good tech spec
monstersDefeated.description: Cross-cultural communication challenges and poor documentation made everything harder than it needed to be.

lootDropped.name: First job ever
lootDropped.description: Transitioned from student to professional developer - a major milestone.

lootDropped.name: Learned what was expected more and more. Accountability, ownership.
lootDropped.description: Professional responsibility means standing behind your code and taking ownership of problems.

title: Contribute to Open Source
description: Created a Blender plugin that shipped with Blender 2.7. First contribution to open source software used by millions worldwide.

lootDropped.name: Learning about python code
lootDropped.description: Added Python to my programming toolkit - a versatile language for tools and scripting.

title: First Job in the Industry
description: Landed my first professional game development job. All the university learning finally put into practice in a real studio environment.

monstersDefeated.name: Motivation
monstersDefeated.description: Transitioning from academic projects to professional work - the pressure is real now.

lootDropped.name: Found love for programming
lootDropped.description: Getting paid to do what I love - the dream is real.

lootDropped.name: Modern C++
lootDropped.description: Applying professional C++ standards in production code.

lootDropped.name: Physics for game developers
lootDropped.description: Using physics knowledge to make games feel natural.

lootDropped.name: Being around people that want to learn and grow
lootDropped.description: Surrounded by passionate developers who push each other to improve.

lootDropped.name: Living by myself
lootDropped.description: Full independence as a working professional.

lootDropped.name: Complete lack of health and how it affects you
lootDropped.description: Learned the hard way that health must be prioritized - burnout is real.

lootDropped.name: Worlds best Rallysport driver!
lootDropped.description: Still got those skills!

lootDropped.name: Even if tasks are not game related you can pretend you are and do the tasks related to that
lootDropped.description: Gamification mindset - making any task more engaging by treating it like a game quest.

title: Mirror's Edge
description: Worked on Mirror's Edge at DICE. My first AAA game title. Learned Unreal Engine, animation programming, and what it really takes to ship a major game.

monstersDefeated.name: Exhausted before crunch even started
monstersDefeated.description: The intensity of AAA development - burnout hit before the final push even began.

lootDropped.name: Animation Programming
lootDropped.description: Specialized skill in making characters move smoothly and naturally.

lootDropped.name: Learned Unreal Engine
lootDropped.description: Mastered one of the industry's most powerful game engines.

lootDropped.name: Working through different phases of a project
lootDropped.description: Experienced the full development cycle from pre-production to launch.

lootDropped.name: Learned talking about tech to non-techy people
lootDropped.description: Communication skill - explaining complex systems in simple terms.

lootDropped.name: Learned Maya and how Technical Animators work
lootDropped.description: Understanding the artist pipeline and tools they use daily.

title: Being a Senior
description: Promoted to Senior Engineer. More responsibility, mentoring others, and deeper technical challenges. Working solo on long-term systems.

monstersDefeated.name: Working by myself for a long time
monstersDefeated.description: Senior engineers often tackle complex problems alone - requires mental fortitude.

lootDropped.name: Working on something longer term and seeing the results of that
lootDropped.description: Building systems that last and evolve over years.

lootDropped.name: One of the most creative things I have done
lootDropped.description: Freedom to architect solutions from the ground up.

lootDropped.name: Passion + time = something unique
lootDropped.description: Deep expertise comes from sustained focus and dedication.

title: Holding a GDC Presentation
description: Presented at Game Developers Conference. Sharing knowledge with the global game development community on a topic I mastered.

monstersDefeated.name: Hard to work with other engineers wanting different things
monstersDefeated.description: Coordinating with team members who have different visions for the presentation.

lootDropped.name: I'm the expert on holding _this_ particular topic
lootDropped.description: Recognition as a subject matter expert in the industry.

title: Ship a Launch Title
description: Shipped a game as a launch title for a new platform. The pressure of being one of the first games on a system is immense.

monstersDefeated.name: Stress and anxiety
monstersDefeated.description: Launch titles have no room for delay - the platform launches with or without you.

lootDropped.name: A game is larger than the participants in its development
lootDropped.description: Games become part of culture - they outlive the team that made them and touch millions of lives.

title: New Job
description: Joined a mobile game studio. Completely different pace with 2-week release cycles on iOS and Android. Had to adapt my work style and learn new platforms.

monstersDefeated.name: Self inflicted stress
monstersDefeated.description: Putting too much pressure on myself - perfectionism at its worst.

monstersDefeated.name: Old life-style doesn't work anymore
monstersDefeated.description: What worked in AAA console development doesn't translate to mobile - had to reinvent my approach.

lootDropped.name: Working with Level Designers
lootDropped.description: Collaborating closely with designers to iterate quickly on gameplay.

lootDropped.name: Values
lootDropped.description: Understanding what truly matters - work-life balance and sustainable development.

lootDropped.name: So many different crafts into making a mobile game
lootDropped.description: Mobile games require diverse skills - from performance optimization to monetization.

lootDropped.name: Unconcious Bias
lootDropped.description: Recognizing my own biases and working to overcome them.

lootDropped.name: Recruiting
lootDropped.description: Learning to identify talent and build strong teams.

lootDropped.name: Be yourself
lootDropped.description: Authenticity is more valuable than trying to fit a mold.

title: Being a Mentor
description: Took on formal mentorship responsibilities. Helping new engineers onboard, find their place, and grow their skills. Leadership through teaching.

lootDropped.name: Show around an office - make sure people have someone to go for lunch with
lootDropped.description: Small acts of kindness make huge differences - making people feel welcome and included.

title: Redesigning the Wheel
description: Led a major architectural refactor. Making large-scale changes to existing systems requires careful planning, strong QA, and good version control strategy.

monstersDefeated.name: Having a good branch strategy working is crucial
monstersDefeated.description: Large refactors fail without proper branching - merge conflicts multiply quickly.

monstersDefeated.name: Having a good QA team is crucial
monstersDefeated.description: You can't test everything yourself - trust and empower your QA team.
